publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1145# Dennis Canavan: Threat to Jobs at TransBus International-That the Parliament is gravely concerned about the fact that the Mayflower Corporation has entered administration with a resultant threat to 1,000 jobs at TransBus International in Falkirk and Larbert and believes that the Scottish Executive should contact the employees' trade union representatives, the administrator and any prospective buyers to offer assistance and advice so that everything possible is done to try to save the jobs of the TransBus workers, who make a very important contribution to the Scottish economy.

S2M-1145# Dennis Canavan: Threat to Jobs at TransBus International-That the Parliament is gravely concerned about the fact that the Mayflower Corporation has entered administration with a resultant threat to 1,000 jobs at TransBus International in Falkirk and Larbert and believes that the Scottish Executive should contact the employees' trade union representatives, the administrator and any prospective buyers to offer assistance and advice so that everything possible is done to try to save the jobs of the TransBus workers who make a very important contribution to the Scottish economy. Supported by: Rob Gibson*, Bristow Muldoon*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Jackie Baillie*, Tricia Marwick*, Margaret Mitchell*, Mike Watson*, Brian Adam*, Mike Pringle*, Donald Gorrie*, Alex Neil*, Michael Matheson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Fiona Hyslop*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Chris Ballance*, Cathy Peattie*, Linda Fabiani*, Bruce Crawford*

S2M-1145# Threat to Jobs at TransBus International (lodged on 1 April 2004) Phil Gallie*, Trish Godman*, John Swinburne*, Ms Sandra White*, Murray Tosh*, Robin Harper*, Carolyn Leckie*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Scott Barrie*, Frances Curran*, Pauline McNeill*
S2M-1145# Threat to Jobs at TransBus International (lodged on 1 April 2004) Christine Grahame*, Karen Gillon*
S2M-1145# Threat to Jobs at TransBus International (lodged on 1 April 2004) Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-1145# Threat to Jobs at TransBus International (lodged on 1 April 2004) Cathie Craigie*, Dr Jean Turner*

S2M-1145# Dennis Canavan: Threat to Jobs at TransBus International-That the Parliament is gravely concerned about the fact that the Mayflower Corporation has entered administration with a resultant threat to 1,000 jobs at TransBus International in Falkirk and Larbert and believes that the Scottish Executive should contact the employees' trade union representatives, the administrator and any prospective buyers to offer assistance and advice so that everything possible is done to try to save the jobs of the TransBus workers who make a very important contribution to the Scottish economy. Supported by: Rob Gibson, Bristow Muldoon, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Jackie Baillie, Tricia Marwick, Margaret Mitchell, Mike Watson, Brian Adam, Mike Pringle, Donald Gorrie, Alex Neil, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Fiona Hyslop, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Chris Ballance, Cathy Peattie, Linda Fabiani, Bruce Crawford, Phil Gallie, Trish Godman, John Swinburne, Ms Sandra White, Murray Tosh, Robin Harper, Carolyn Leckie, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Scott Barrie, Frances Curran, Pauline McNeill, Christine Grahame, Karen Gillon, Tommy Sheridan, Cathie Craigie, Dr Jean Turner
